main.name: Meincken
main.description: I build websites and component libraries for pretty much anything.
main.bio: I am an experienced AEM Front End Developer. I specialise in creating clean semantic code to ensure fast loadtimes. A champion of atomic design principles and where possible, develop style guides and pattern libraries to ensure consistant and rapid develpment when working as part of a team. I am as comfortable coding in raw HTML as I am using products such as React. I enjoy working as part of an Agile team and have worked on some of the countries largest ecommerce sites.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I am a competent Front End Developer with good skills with many frameworks and content management systems. Below is my level of competency with various technologies.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Building AEM components for Siemens using postcss and PatternLab. This project contained the use of Stylelint, PostCSS and BEM within Gulp. It drew in a lot of style rules from other projects created by Signal Noise for Siemens.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Building components around the bootstrap framework for a Medical website utilising Handlebars, LESS and jQuery. Sample components and page templates for a CMS. Built the base for reusable components and sections.

work.title: Front End Engineer & Email Developer
work.description: BT is a globally recognized telecoms brand. I have been working as part of the Marketing, Brand and Data teams in rebuilding their email templates in AEM for integration into ACM. My main task has been migrating and updating the email templates within AEM to be responsive with more control for the user. I have also worked on a number microsites for campaigns within ACM (Adobe Campaign).

work.title: Front End UI Developer
work.description: GTA Travel have been powering global travel for 40 years. I came on board as part of the marketing team to work on marketing projects and general site optimisation. I am also part of a wider group that has been tasked to create new components and develop a style guide for the site.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Working as part of a small agile development team in Old Street on a high quality, design led project updating a boutique travel website. Building on modular patterns for CSS, JS and HTML for a CMS.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Working as part of a small development team building custom websites for corporate finance using .Net and Umbraco. I provided support for existing websites and updating an older site to newer code base and cleaning up the HTML.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Cleaning up the code base of this prestige clothing brand and general site and performance improvements as well as building the new about pages on Wordpress and the updated Cycle Club section.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Microsite for Blind Pig Cider using Wordpress with custom fields and utilising a mobile first design principle as well as improving the mixins for SCSS.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: One of the UK's leading entertainment and communication providers, I was a member of a team of developers working on moving Virgin Media to a fully responsive website and migrating from multiple instances of CQ5 to a single version of AEM6. First hand experience with AEM adapting many of the core components within AEM to modified and customised versions specifically for Virgin Media, as well as custom components.

projects.title: Meincken (Personal site)
projects.category: Personal blog for me, I plan on using this to host my other off web projects in the future and updates on my adventures.

projects.title: Built By Moustache
projects.category: Company website for my own web services.

projects.title: Belmond
projects.category: I built components for this site whilst working for MOF.

projects.title: BT Business
projects.category: I have built components for AEM for use in Email and integration into ACM.

projects.title: Blind Pig
projects.category: Wordpress site for WeAreSocial using a number of technologies.

projects.title: Rapha
projects.category: I worked on a few different sections of this site before the relaunch.

projects.title: Virgin Media
projects.category: I built out a styleguide and pattern library as well as a number of components for AEM6.

articlecontent.content: I am an experienced AEM Front End Developer.  I specialise in creating clean semantic code to ensure fast loadtimes.  I follow atomic design principles where possible and develop style guides to ensure consistant and rapid develpment when working as part of a team.  I am as comfortable coding in raw HTML as I am using products such as React.
I enjoy working as part of an Agile team and have worked on some of the countries largest ecommerce sites.

list.strong: 6 GCSEs including Maths, English and Science

list.item: CSS and HTML editing using text editor
Mac oSX, Linux and Windows compliant
SASS, PostCSS, Grunt, Gulp, Webpack, Parcel

experience.description: Building AEM components for Siemens using postcss and PatternLab. This project contained the use of Stylelint, PostCSS and BEM within Gulp. It drew in a lot of style rules from other projects created by Signal Noise for Siemens.

Building components around the bootstrap framework for a Medical website utilising Handlebars, LESS and jQuery. Sample components and page templates for a CMS. Built the base for reusable components and sections.

BT is a globally recognized telecoms brand. I have been working as part of the Marketing, Brand and Data teams in rebuilding their email templates in AEM for integration into ACM. My main task has been migrating and updating the email templates within AEM to be responsive with more control for the user. I have also worked on a number microsites for campaigns within ACM (Adobe Campaign).

GTA Travel have been powering global travel for 40 years. I came on board as part of the marketing team to work on marketing projects and general site optimisation. I am also part of a wider group that has been tasked to create new components and develop a style guide for the site.
Working as part of a small agile development team in Old Street on a high quality, design led project updating a boutique travel website. Building on modular patterns for CSS, JS and HTML for a CMS.
Working as part of a small development team building custom websites for corporate finance using .Net and Umbraco. Support for existing websites and updating an older site to newer code base.
Cleaning up the code base of this prestige clothing brand and general site and performance improvements as well as building the new about pages on Wordpress and the updated Cycle Club section.
Microsite for Blind Pig Cider using Wordpress with custom fields and utilising a mobile first design principle as well as improving the mixins for SCSS.

One of the UK's leading entertainment and communication providers, I was a member of a team of developers working on moving Virgin Media to a fully responsive website and migrating from multiple instances of CQ5 to a single version of AEM6. First hand experience with AEM adapting many of the core components within AEM to modified and customised versions specifically for Virgin Media, as well as custom components.

list.item: Usage of HTML5, jQuery and CSS3
